intro: Rubus trigonodontos, commonly known as the three-lobed blackberry, is a species of flowering plant in the Rosaceae family. It is characterized by its thorny stems and aggregate fruits, which are typically dark purple to black in color. The plant produces small white flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by the development of its edible berries. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodland edges and disturbed soils. The leaves are trifoliate, with three leaflets that are serrated and have a slightly hairy texture.
